resources.string: I have been an avid Android learner for a few years now. I mainly use Kotlin and Java in my code. Go through my portfolio, listen to my elevator pitch and let\'s chat.

I undertook the Google Africa Developer Scholarship programme for six months. I ended up earning the final scholarship and attaining the project phase as well as certification. In the end it provided a solid mobile development foundation as well as making it easier for me to learn other programming languages

This is a recipe application built using JetPack Compose. When making the app I solidified my skills in compose, kotlin, dependency injection with dagger-hilt, room data storage as well as retrofit since the app fetches data from the spoonacular api

This application is written in Kotlin and uses the usual xmls. What I learnt while making the app includes: dependency injection using koin, implementation of work manager, test-diven-development as well as use of room for data storage

string-array.name: what_i_offer
string-array.item: Solid understanding of the full mobile development cycle
Good exposure to overall application development, design and testing
Proficiency in object-oriented design, data structures, problem solving, complexity analysis and debugging
Good knowledge of version control and bug tracking
Ability to work long hours to meet any set deadline efficiently
Good understanding in third-party libraries and techniques such as DaggerHilt, Koin and Retrofit
Dedication to improvement by discovering, evaluating and implementing new technologies
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Most importantly, I offer a cool head under pressure and good banter
